>why do you think gaming laptops are still worth it despite the costs and lack of upgrade abilities compared to desktops?

It only has worth to those who actually need the performance to be portable, and it's not possible to use an SFF PC or use a work laptop and have a separate desktop at home.

Gaming laptops are pretty niche in that sense that while they will never be on par with a dedicated desktop for gaming, or on par with a non-gaming laptop for battery efficiency, they're still a whole lot more portable than a desktop setup and more powerful than a non-gaming laptop for graphical use. If your use case needs both portability and power, and would like have just one machine, then it makes it worth it for you.
